24#define TRACE_BS(...) \
25 do { \
26 if (v8_flags.trace_backing_store) PrintF(__VA_ARGS__); \
27 } while (false)
28
29namespace v8 {
30namespace internal {
31
32namespace {
33
34#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
35constexpr uint64_t kNegativeGuardSize = uint64_t{2} * GB;
36
37#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_64_BIT
38constexpr uint64_t kFullGuardSize32 = uint64_t{10} * GB;
39constexpr uint64_t kFullGuardSize64 = uint64_t{32} * GB;
40#endif
41
42#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
43
44std::atomic<uint32_t> next_backing_store_id_{1};
45
46// Allocation results are reported to UMA
47//
48// See wasm_memory_allocation_result in counters-definitions.h
49enum class AllocationStatus {
50 kSuccess, // Succeeded on the first try
51
52 kSuccessAfterRetry, // Succeeded after garbage collection
53
54 kAddressSpaceLimitReachedFailure, // Failed because Wasm is at its address
55 // space limit
56
57 kOtherFailure // Failed for an unknown reason
58};
59
60base::AddressRegion GetReservedRegion(bool has_guard_regions,
61 bool is_wasm_memory64, void* buffer_start,
62 size_t byte_capacity) {
63#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_64_BIT && V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
64 if (has_guard_regions) {
65 Address start = reinterpret_cast<Address>(buffer_start);
66 DCHECK_EQ(8, sizeof(size_t)); // only use on 64-bit
67 DCHECK_EQ(0, start % AllocatePageSize());
68 if (is_wasm_memory64) {
69 DCHECK(v8_flags.wasm_memory64_trap_handling);
70 static_assert(kFullGuardSize64 ==
71 2 * wasm::kV8MaxWasmMemory64Pages * wasm::kWasmPageSize);
72 DCHECK_LE(byte_capacity,
73 wasm::kV8MaxWasmMemory64Pages * wasm::kWasmPageSize);
74 return base::AddressRegion(
75 start,
76 1ULL << wasm::WasmMemory::GetMemory64GuardsShift(byte_capacity));
77 } else {
78 // Guard regions always look like this:
79 // |xxx(2GiB)xxx|.......(4GiB)..xxxxx|xxxxxx(4GiB)xxxxxx|
80 // ^ buffer_start
81 // ^ byte_length
82 // ^ negative guard region ^ positive guard region
83
84 return base::AddressRegion(start - kNegativeGuardSize,
85 static_cast<size_t>(kFullGuardSize32));
86 }
87 }
88#endif
89
90 DCHECK(!has_guard_regions);
91 return base::AddressRegion(reinterpret_cast<Address>(buffer_start),
92 byte_capacity);
93}
94
95size_t GetReservationSize(bool has_guard_regions, size_t byte_capacity,
96 bool is_wasm_memory64) {
97#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_64_BIT && V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
98 if (has_guard_regions) {
99 if (is_wasm_memory64) {
100 DCHECK(v8_flags.wasm_memory64_trap_handling);
101 static_assert(kFullGuardSize64 ==
102 2 * wasm::kV8MaxWasmMemory64Pages * wasm::kWasmPageSize);
103 DCHECK_LE(byte_capacity,
104 wasm::kV8MaxWasmMemory64Pages * wasm::kWasmPageSize);
105 return 1ULL << wasm::WasmMemory::GetMemory64GuardsShift(byte_capacity);
106 } else {
107 static_assert(kFullGuardSize32 >= size_t{4} * GB);
108 DCHECK_LE(byte_capacity, size_t{4} * GB);
109 return kFullGuardSize32;
110 }
111 }
112#else
113 DCHECK(!has_guard_regions);
114#endif
115
116 return byte_capacity;
117}
118
119void RecordStatus(Isolate* isolate, AllocationStatus status) {
120 isolate->counters()->wasm_memory_allocation_result()->AddSample(
121 static_cast<int>(status));
122}
123
124} // namespace
125
126// The backing store for a Wasm shared memory remembers all the isolates
127// with which it has been shared.
128struct SharedWasmMemoryData {
129 std::vector<Isolate*> isolates_;
130};
131
132BackingStore::BackingStore(void* buffer_start, size_t byte_length,
133 size_t max_byte_length, size_t byte_capacity,
134 SharedFlag shared, ResizableFlag resizable,
135 bool is_wasm_memory, bool is_wasm_memory64,
136 bool has_guard_regions, bool custom_deleter,
137 bool empty_deleter)
138 : buffer_start_(buffer_start),
139 byte_length_(byte_length),
140 max_byte_length_(max_byte_length),
141 byte_capacity_(byte_capacity),
142 id_(next_backing_store_id_.fetch_add(1)),
143 is_shared_(shared == SharedFlag::kShared),
144 is_resizable_by_js_(resizable == ResizableFlag::kResizable),
145 is_wasm_memory_(is_wasm_memory),
146 is_wasm_memory64_(is_wasm_memory64),
147 holds_shared_ptr_to_allocator_(false),
148 has_guard_regions_(has_guard_regions),
149 globally_registered_(false),
150 custom_deleter_(custom_deleter),
151 empty_deleter_(empty_deleter) {
152 // TODO(v8:11111): RAB / GSAB - Wasm integration.
153 DCHECK_IMPLIES(is_wasm_memory_, !is_resizable_by_js_);
154 DCHECK_IMPLIES(is_resizable_by_js_, !custom_deleter_);
155 DCHECK_IMPLIES(!is_wasm_memory && !is_resizable_by_js_,
156 byte_length_ == max_byte_length_);
157 DCHECK_GE(max_byte_length_, byte_length_);
158 DCHECK_GE(byte_capacity_, max_byte_length_);
159 // TODO(1445003): Demote to a DCHECK once we found the issue.
160 // Wasm memory should never be empty (== zero capacity). Otherwise
161 // {JSArrayBuffer::Attach} would replace it by the {EmptyBackingStore} and we
162 // loose information.
163 // This is particularly important for shared Wasm memory.
164 CHECK_IMPLIES(is_wasm_memory_, byte_capacity_ != 0);
165}
166
167BackingStore::~BackingStore() {
168 GlobalBackingStoreRegistry::Unregister(this);
169
170 struct ClearSharedAllocator {
171 BackingStore* const bs;
172
173 ~ClearSharedAllocator() {
174 if (!bs->holds_shared_ptr_to_allocator_) return;
175 bs->type_specific_data_.v8_api_array_buffer_allocator_shared
176 .std::shared_ptr<v8::ArrayBuffer::Allocator>::~shared_ptr();
177 }
178 } clear_shared_allocator{this};
179
180 if (buffer_start_ == nullptr) return;
181
182 auto FreeResizableMemory = [this] {
183 DCHECK(!custom_deleter_);
184 DCHECK(is_resizable_by_js_ || is_wasm_memory_);
185 auto region = GetReservedRegion(has_guard_regions_, is_wasm_memory64_,
186 buffer_start_, byte_capacity_);
187
188 PageAllocator* page_allocator = GetArrayBufferPageAllocator();
189 if (!region.is_empty()) {
190 FreePages(page_allocator, reinterpret_cast<void*>(region.begin()),
191 region.size());
192 }
193 };
194
195#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
196 if (is_wasm_memory_) {
197 // TODO(v8:11111): RAB / GSAB - Wasm integration.
198 DCHECK(!is_resizable_by_js_);
199 size_t reservation_size = GetReservationSize(
200 has_guard_regions_, byte_capacity_, is_wasm_memory64_);
201 TRACE_BS(
202 "BSw:free bs=%p mem=%p (length=%zu, capacity=%zu, reservation=%zu)\n",
203 this, buffer_start_, byte_length(), byte_capacity_, reservation_size);
204 if (is_shared_) {
205 // Deallocate the list of attached memory objects.
206 SharedWasmMemoryData* shared_data = get_shared_wasm_memory_data();
207 delete shared_data;
208 }
209 // Wasm memories are always allocated through the page allocator.
210 FreeResizableMemory();
211 return;
212 }
213#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
214
215 if (is_resizable_by_js_) {
216 FreeResizableMemory();
217 return;
218 }
219
220 if (custom_deleter_) {
221 TRACE_BS("BS:custom deleter bs=%p mem=%p (length=%zu, capacity=%zu)\n",
222 this, buffer_start_, byte_length(), byte_capacity_);
223 type_specific_data_.deleter.callback(buffer_start_, byte_length_,
224 type_specific_data_.deleter.data);
225 return;
226 }
227
228 // JSArrayBuffer backing store. Deallocate through the embedder's allocator.
229 auto allocator = get_v8_api_array_buffer_allocator();
230 TRACE_BS("BS:free bs=%p mem=%p (length=%zu, capacity=%zu)\n", this,
231 buffer_start_, byte_length(), byte_capacity_);
232 allocator->Free(buffer_start_, byte_length_);
233}
234
235// Allocate a backing store using the array buffer allocator from the embedder.
236std::unique_ptr<BackingStore> BackingStore::Allocate(
237 Isolate* isolate, size_t byte_length, SharedFlag shared,
238 InitializedFlag initialized) {
239 void* buffer_start = nullptr;
240 auto allocator = isolate->array_buffer_allocator();
241 CHECK_NOT_NULL(allocator);
242 if (byte_length != 0) {
243 auto counters = isolate->counters();
244 int mb_length = static_cast<int>(byte_length / MB);
245 if (mb_length > 0) {
246 counters->array_buffer_big_allocations()->AddSample(mb_length);
247 }
248 if (shared == SharedFlag::kShared) {
249 counters->shared_array_allocations()->AddSample(mb_length);
250 }
251 auto allocate_buffer = [allocator, initialized](size_t byte_length) {
252 if (initialized == InitializedFlag::kUninitialized) {
253 return allocator->AllocateUninitialized(byte_length);
254 }
255 return allocator->Allocate(byte_length);
256 };
257
258 buffer_start = isolate->heap()->AllocateExternalBackingStore(
259 allocate_buffer, byte_length);
260
261 if (buffer_start == nullptr) {
262 // Allocation failed.
263 counters->array_buffer_new_size_failures()->AddSample(mb_length);
264 return {};
265 }
266#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
267 // Check to catch use of a non-sandbox-compatible ArrayBufferAllocator.
268 CHECK_WITH_MSG(GetProcessWideSandbox()->Contains(buffer_start),
269 "When the V8 Sandbox is enabled, ArrayBuffer backing stores "
270 "must be allocated inside the sandbox address space. Please "
271 "use an appropriate ArrayBuffer::Allocator to allocate "
272 "these buffers, or disable the sandbox.");
273#endif
274 }
275
276 auto result = new BackingStore(buffer_start, // start
277 byte_length, // length
278 byte_length, // max length
279 byte_length, // capacity
280 shared, // shared
281 ResizableFlag::kNotResizable, // resizable
282 false, // is_wasm_memory
283 false, // is_wasm_memory64
284 false, // has_guard_regions
285 false, // custom_deleter
286 false); // empty_deleter
287
288 TRACE_BS("BS:alloc bs=%p mem=%p (length=%zu)\n", result,
289 result->buffer_start(), byte_length);
290 result->SetAllocatorFromIsolate(isolate);
291 return std::unique_ptr<BackingStore>(result);
292}
293
294void BackingStore::SetAllocatorFromIsolate(Isolate* isolate) {
295 if (auto allocator_shared = isolate->array_buffer_allocator_shared()) {
296 holds_shared_ptr_to_allocator_ = true;
297 new (&type_specific_data_.v8_api_array_buffer_allocator_shared)
298 std::shared_ptr<v8::ArrayBuffer::Allocator>(
299 std::move(allocator_shared));
300 } else {
301 type_specific_data_.v8_api_array_buffer_allocator =
302 isolate->array_buffer_allocator();
303 }
304}
305
306std::unique_ptr<BackingStore> BackingStore::TryAllocateAndPartiallyCommitMemory(
307 Isolate* isolate, size_t byte_length, size_t max_byte_length,
308 size_t page_size, size_t initial_pages, size_t maximum_pages,
309 WasmMemoryFlag wasm_memory, SharedFlag shared) {
310 // Enforce engine limitation on the maximum number of pages.
311 if (maximum_pages > std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max() / page_size) {
312 return nullptr;
313 }
314
315 // Cannot reserve 0 pages on some OSes.
316 if (maximum_pages == 0) maximum_pages = 1;
317
318 TRACE_BS("BSw:try %zu pages, %zu max\n", initial_pages, maximum_pages);
319
320#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
321 bool is_wasm_memory64 = wasm_memory == WasmMemoryFlag::kWasmMemory64;
322 bool guards = trap_handler::IsTrapHandlerEnabled() &&
323 (wasm_memory == WasmMemoryFlag::kWasmMemory32 ||
324 (is_wasm_memory64 && v8_flags.wasm_memory64_trap_handling));
325#else
326 CHECK_EQ(WasmMemoryFlag::kNotWasm, wasm_memory);
327 constexpr bool is_wasm_memory64 = false;
328 constexpr bool guards = false;
329#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
330
331 // For accounting purposes, whether a GC was necessary.
332 bool did_retry = false;
333
334 // A helper to try running a function up to 3 times, executing a GC
335 // if the first and second attempts failed.
336 auto gc_retry = [&](const std::function<bool()>& fn) {
337 for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
338 if (fn()) return true;
339 // Collect garbage and retry.
340 did_retry = true;
341 if (isolate != nullptr) {
342 isolate->heap()->MemoryPressureNotification(
343 MemoryPressureLevel::kCritical, true);
344 }
345 }
346 return false;
347 };
348
349 size_t byte_capacity = maximum_pages * page_size;
350 size_t reservation_size =
351 GetReservationSize(guards, byte_capacity, is_wasm_memory64);
352
353 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
354 // Allocate pages (inaccessible by default).
355 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
356 void* allocation_base = nullptr;
357 PageAllocator* page_allocator = GetArrayBufferPageAllocator();
358 auto allocate_pages = [&] {
359 allocation_base = AllocatePages(page_allocator, nullptr, reservation_size,
360 page_size, PageAllocator::kNoAccess);
361 return allocation_base != nullptr;
362 };
363 if (!gc_retry(allocate_pages)) {
364 // Page allocator could not reserve enough pages.
365 if (isolate != nullptr) {
366 RecordStatus(isolate, AllocationStatus::kOtherFailure);
367 }
368 TRACE_BS("BSw:try failed to allocate pages\n");
369 return {};
370 }
371
372 // Get a pointer to the start of the buffer, skipping negative guard region
373 // if necessary.
374#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
375 uint8_t* buffer_start =
376 reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(allocation_base) +
377 (guards && !is_wasm_memory64 ? kNegativeGuardSize : 0);
378#else
379 DCHECK(!guards);
380 uint8_t* buffer_start = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(allocation_base);
381#endif
382
383 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
384 // Commit the initial pages (allow read/write).
385 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
386 size_t committed_byte_length = initial_pages * page_size;
387 auto commit_memory = [&] {
388 return committed_byte_length == 0 ||
389 SetPermissions(page_allocator, buffer_start, committed_byte_length,
390 PageAllocator::kReadWrite);
391 };
392 if (!gc_retry(commit_memory)) {
393 TRACE_BS("BSw:try failed to set permissions (%p, %zu)\n", buffer_start,
394 committed_byte_length);
395 FreePages(page_allocator, allocation_base, reservation_size);
396 // SetPermissions put us over the process memory limit.
397 // We return an empty result so that the caller can throw an exception.
398 return {};
399 }
400
401 if (isolate != nullptr) {
402 RecordStatus(isolate, did_retry ? AllocationStatus::kSuccessAfterRetry
403 : AllocationStatus::kSuccess);
404 }
405
406 const bool is_wasm_memory = wasm_memory != WasmMemoryFlag::kNotWasm;
407 ResizableFlag resizable =
408 is_wasm_memory ? ResizableFlag::kNotResizable : ResizableFlag::kResizable;
409
410 auto result = new BackingStore(buffer_start, // start
411 byte_length, // length
412 max_byte_length, // max_byte_length
413 byte_capacity, // capacity
414 shared, // shared
415 resizable, // resizable
416 is_wasm_memory, // is_wasm_memory
417 is_wasm_memory64, // is_wasm_memory64
418 guards, // has_guard_regions
419 false, // custom_deleter
420 false); // empty_deleter
421
422 TRACE_BS(
423 "BSw:alloc bs=%p mem=%p (length=%zu, capacity=%zu, reservation=%zu)\n",
424 result, result->buffer_start(), byte_length, byte_capacity,
425 reservation_size);
426
427 return std::unique_ptr<BackingStore>(result);
428}
429
430#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
431// Allocate a backing store for a Wasm memory. Always use the page allocator
432// and add guard regions.
433std::unique_ptr<BackingStore> BackingStore::AllocateWasmMemory(
434 Isolate* isolate, size_t initial_pages, size_t maximum_pages,
435 WasmMemoryFlag wasm_memory, SharedFlag shared) {
436 // Wasm pages must be a multiple of the allocation page size.
437 DCHECK_EQ(0, wasm::kWasmPageSize % AllocatePageSize());
438 DCHECK_LE(initial_pages, maximum_pages);
439
440 DCHECK(wasm_memory == WasmMemoryFlag::kWasmMemory32 ||
441 wasm_memory == WasmMemoryFlag::kWasmMemory64);
442
443 auto TryAllocate = [isolate, initial_pages, wasm_memory,
444 shared](size_t maximum_pages) {
445 auto result = TryAllocateAndPartiallyCommitMemory(
446 isolate, initial_pages * wasm::kWasmPageSize,
447 maximum_pages * wasm::kWasmPageSize, wasm::kWasmPageSize, initial_pages,
448 maximum_pages, wasm_memory, shared);
449 if (result && shared == SharedFlag::kShared) {
450 result->type_specific_data_.shared_wasm_memory_data =
451 new SharedWasmMemoryData();
452 }
453 return result;
454 };
455 auto backing_store = TryAllocate(maximum_pages);
456 if (!backing_store && maximum_pages - initial_pages >= 4) {
457 // Retry with smaller maximum pages at each retry.
458 auto delta = (maximum_pages - initial_pages) / 4;
459 size_t sizes[] = {maximum_pages - delta, maximum_pages - 2 * delta,
460 maximum_pages - 3 * delta, initial_pages};
461
462 for (size_t reduced_maximum_pages : sizes) {
463 backing_store = TryAllocate(reduced_maximum_pages);
464 if (backing_store) break;
465 }
466 }
467 return backing_store;
468}
469
470std::unique_ptr<BackingStore> BackingStore::CopyWasmMemory(
471 Isolate* isolate, size_t new_pages, size_t max_pages,
472 WasmMemoryFlag wasm_memory) {
473 // Note that we could allocate uninitialized to save initialization cost here,
474 // but since Wasm memories are allocated by the page allocator, the zeroing
475 // cost is already built-in.
476 auto new_backing_store = BackingStore::AllocateWasmMemory(
477 isolate, new_pages, max_pages, wasm_memory,
478 is_shared() ? SharedFlag::kShared : SharedFlag::kNotShared);
479
480 if (!new_backing_store ||
481 new_backing_store->has_guard_regions() != has_guard_regions_) {
482 return {};
483 }
484
485 if (byte_length_ > 0) {
486 // If the allocation was successful, then the new buffer must be at least
487 // as big as the old one.
488 DCHECK_GE(new_pages * wasm::kWasmPageSize, byte_length_);
489 memcpy(new_backing_store->buffer_start(), buffer_start_, byte_length_);
490 }
491
492 return new_backing_store;
493}
494
495// Try to grow the size of a wasm memory in place, without realloc + copy.
496base::Optional<size_t> BackingStore::GrowWasmMemoryInPlace(Isolate* isolate,
497 size_t delta_pages,
498 size_t max_pages) {
499 // This function grows wasm memory by
500 // * changing the permissions of additional {delta_pages} pages to kReadWrite;
501 // * increment {byte_length_};
502 //
503 // As this code is executed concurrently, the following steps are executed:
504 // 1) Read the current value of {byte_length_};
505 // 2) Change the permission of all pages from {buffer_start_} to
506 // {byte_length_} + {delta_pages} * {page_size} to kReadWrite;
507 // * This operation may be executed racefully. The OS takes care of
508 // synchronization.
509 // 3) Try to update {byte_length_} with a compare_exchange;
510 // 4) Repeat 1) to 3) until the compare_exchange in 3) succeeds;
511 //
512 // The result of this function is the {byte_length_} before growing in pages.
513 // The result of this function appears like the result of an RMW-update on
514 // {byte_length_}, i.e. two concurrent calls to this function will result in
515 // different return values if {delta_pages} != 0.
516 //
517 // Invariants:
518 // * Permissions are always set incrementally, i.e. for any page {b} with
519 // kReadWrite permission, all pages between the first page {a} and page {b}
520 // also have kReadWrite permission.
521 // * {byte_length_} is always lower or equal than the amount of memory with
522 // permissions set to kReadWrite;
523 // * This is guaranteed by incrementing {byte_length_} with a
524 // compare_exchange after changing the permissions.
525 // * This invariant is the reason why we cannot use a fetch_add.
526 DCHECK(is_wasm_memory_);
527 max_pages = std::min(max_pages, byte_capacity_ / wasm::kWasmPageSize);
528
529 // Do a compare-exchange loop, because we also need to adjust page
530 // permissions. Note that multiple racing grows both try to set page
531 // permissions for the entire range (to be RW), so the operating system
532 // should deal with that raciness. We know we succeeded when we can
533 // compare/swap the old length with the new length.
534 size_t old_length = byte_length_.load(std::memory_order_relaxed);
535
536 if (delta_pages == 0)
537 return {old_length / wasm::kWasmPageSize}; // degenerate grow.
538 if (delta_pages > max_pages) return {}; // would never work.
539
540 size_t new_length = 0;
541 while (true) {
542 size_t current_pages = old_length / wasm::kWasmPageSize;
543
544 // Check if we have exceed the supplied maximum.
545 if (current_pages > (max_pages - delta_pages)) return {};
546
547 new_length = (current_pages + delta_pages) * wasm::kWasmPageSize;
548
549 // Try to adjust the permissions on the memory.
550 if (!i::SetPermissions(GetPlatformPageAllocator(), buffer_start_,
551 new_length, PageAllocator::kReadWrite)) {
552 return {};
553 }
554 if (byte_length_.compare_exchange_weak(old_length, new_length,
555 std::memory_order_acq_rel)) {
556 // Successfully updated both the length and permissions.
557 break;
558 }
559 }
560
561 if (!is_shared_) {
562 // Only do per-isolate accounting for non-shared backing stores.
563 reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(isolate)
564 ->AdjustAmountOfExternalAllocatedMemory(new_length - old_length);
565 }
566 return {old_length / wasm::kWasmPageSize};
567}
568
569void BackingStore::AttachSharedWasmMemoryObject(
570 Isolate* isolate, Handle<WasmMemoryObject> memory_object) {
571 DCHECK(is_wasm_memory_);
572 DCHECK(is_shared_);
573 // We need to take the global registry lock for this operation.
574 GlobalBackingStoreRegistry::AddSharedWasmMemoryObject(isolate, this,
575 memory_object);
576}
577
578void BackingStore::BroadcastSharedWasmMemoryGrow(Isolate* isolate) const {
579 GlobalBackingStoreRegistry::BroadcastSharedWasmMemoryGrow(isolate, this);
580}
581
582void BackingStore::RemoveSharedWasmMemoryObjects(Isolate* isolate) {
583 GlobalBackingStoreRegistry::Purge(isolate);
584}
585
586void BackingStore::UpdateSharedWasmMemoryObjects(Isolate* isolate) {
587 GlobalBackingStoreRegistry::UpdateSharedWasmMemoryObjects(isolate);
588}
589#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
590
591// Commit already reserved memory (for RAB backing stores (not shared)).
592BackingStore::ResizeOrGrowResult BackingStore::ResizeInPlace(
593 Isolate* isolate, size_t new_byte_length) {
594 size_t page_size = AllocatePageSize();
595 size_t new_committed_pages;
596 bool round_return_value =
597 RoundUpToPageSize(new_byte_length, page_size,
598 JSArrayBuffer::kMaxByteLength, &new_committed_pages);
599 CHECK(round_return_value);
600
601 size_t new_committed_length = new_committed_pages * page_size;
602 DCHECK_LE(new_byte_length, new_committed_length);
603 DCHECK(!is_shared());
604
605 if (new_byte_length < byte_length_) {
606 // Zero the memory so that in case the buffer is grown later, we have
607 // zeroed the contents already. This is especially needed for the portion of
608 // the memory we're not going to decommit below (since it belongs to a
609 // committed page). In addition, we don't rely on all platforms always
610 // zeroing decommitted-then-recommitted memory, but zero the memory
611 // explicitly here.
612 memset(reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(buffer_start_) + new_byte_length, 0,
613 byte_length_ - new_byte_length);
614
615 // Check if we can un-commit some pages.
616 size_t old_committed_pages;
617 round_return_value =
618 RoundUpToPageSize(byte_length_, page_size,
619 JSArrayBuffer::kMaxByteLength, &old_committed_pages);
620 CHECK(round_return_value);
621 DCHECK_LE(new_committed_pages, old_committed_pages);
622
623 if (new_committed_pages < old_committed_pages) {
624 size_t old_committed_length = old_committed_pages * page_size;
625 if (!i::SetPermissions(
626 GetPlatformPageAllocator(),
627 reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(buffer_start_) + new_committed_length,
628 old_committed_length - new_committed_length,
629 PageAllocator::kNoAccess)) {
630 return kFailure;
631 }
632 }
633
634 // Changing the byte length wouldn't strictly speaking be needed, since
635 // the JSArrayBuffer already stores the updated length. This is to keep
636 // the BackingStore and JSArrayBuffer in sync.
637 byte_length_ = new_byte_length;
638 return kSuccess;
639 }
640 if (new_byte_length == byte_length_) {
641 // i::SetPermissions with size 0 fails on some platforms, so special
642 // handling for the case byte_length_ == new_byte_length == 0 is required.
643 return kSuccess;
644 }
645
646 // Try to adjust the permissions on the memory.
647 if (!i::SetPermissions(GetPlatformPageAllocator(), buffer_start_,
648 new_committed_length, PageAllocator::kReadWrite)) {
649 return kFailure;
650 }
651
652 // Do per-isolate accounting for non-shared backing stores.
653 reinterpret_cast<v8::Isolate*>(isolate)
654 ->AdjustAmountOfExternalAllocatedMemory(new_byte_length - byte_length_);
655 byte_length_ = new_byte_length;
656 return kSuccess;
657}
658
659// Commit already reserved memory (for GSAB backing stores (shared)).
660BackingStore::ResizeOrGrowResult BackingStore::GrowInPlace(
661 Isolate* isolate, size_t new_byte_length) {
662 size_t page_size = AllocatePageSize();
663 size_t new_committed_pages;
664 bool round_return_value =
665 RoundUpToPageSize(new_byte_length, page_size,
666 JSArrayBuffer::kMaxByteLength, &new_committed_pages);
667 CHECK(round_return_value);
668
669 size_t new_committed_length = new_committed_pages * page_size;
670 DCHECK_LE(new_byte_length, new_committed_length);
671 DCHECK(is_shared());
672 // See comment in GrowWasmMemoryInPlace.
673 // GrowableSharedArrayBuffer.prototype.grow can be called from several
674 // threads. If two threads try to grow() in a racy way, the spec allows the
675 // larger grow to throw also if the smaller grow succeeds first. The
676 // implementation below doesn't throw in that case - instead, it retries and
677 // succeeds. If the larger grow finishes first though, the smaller grow must
678 // throw.
679 size_t old_byte_length = byte_length_.load(std::memory_order_seq_cst);
680 while (true) {
681 if (new_byte_length < old_byte_length) {
682 // The caller checks for the new_byte_length < old_byte_length_ case. This
683 // can only happen if another thread grew the memory after that.
684 return kRace;
685 }
686 if (new_byte_length == old_byte_length) {
687 // i::SetPermissions with size 0 fails on some platforms, so special
688 // handling for the case old_byte_length == new_byte_length == 0 is
689 // required.
690 return kSuccess;
691 }
692
693 // Try to adjust the permissions on the memory.
694 if (!i::SetPermissions(GetPlatformPageAllocator(), buffer_start_,
695 new_committed_length, PageAllocator::kReadWrite)) {
696 return kFailure;
697 }
698
699 // compare_exchange_weak updates old_byte_length.
700 if (byte_length_.compare_exchange_weak(old_byte_length, new_byte_length,
701 std::memory_order_seq_cst)) {
702 // Successfully updated both the length and permissions.
703 break;
704 }
705 }
706 return kSuccess;
707}
708
709std::unique_ptr<BackingStore> BackingStore::WrapAllocation(
710 void* allocation_base, size_t allocation_length,
711 v8::BackingStore::DeleterCallback deleter, void* deleter_data,
712 SharedFlag shared) {
713 bool is_empty_deleter = (deleter == v8::BackingStore::EmptyDeleter);
714 auto result = new BackingStore(allocation_base, // start
715 allocation_length, // length
716 allocation_length, // max length
717 allocation_length, // capacity
718 shared, // shared
719 ResizableFlag::kNotResizable, // resizable
720 false, // is_wasm_memory
721 false, // is_wasm_memory64
722 false, // has_guard_regions
723 true, // custom_deleter
724 is_empty_deleter); // empty_deleter
725 result->type_specific_data_.deleter = {deleter, deleter_data};
726 TRACE_BS("BS:wrap bs=%p mem=%p (length=%zu)\n", result,
727 result->buffer_start(), result->byte_length());
728 return std::unique_ptr<BackingStore>(result);
729}
730
731std::unique_ptr<BackingStore> BackingStore::EmptyBackingStore(
732 SharedFlag shared) {
733 auto result = new BackingStore(nullptr, // start
734 0, // length
735 0, // max length
736 0, // capacity
737 shared, // shared
738 ResizableFlag::kNotResizable, // resizable
739 false, // is_wasm_memory
740 false, // is_wasm_memory64
741 false, // has_guard_regions
742 false, // custom_deleter
743 false); // empty_deleter
744
745 return std::unique_ptr<BackingStore>(result);
746}
747
748bool BackingStore::Reallocate(Isolate* isolate, size_t new_byte_length) {
749 CHECK(CanReallocate());
750 auto allocator = get_v8_api_array_buffer_allocator();
751 CHECK_EQ(isolate->array_buffer_allocator(), allocator);
752 CHECK_EQ(byte_length_, byte_capacity_);
753 START_ALLOW_USE_DEPRECATED()
754 void* new_start =
755 allocator->Reallocate(buffer_start_, byte_length_, new_byte_length);
756 END_ALLOW_USE_DEPRECATED()
757 if (!new_start) return false;
758 buffer_start_ = new_start;
759 byte_capacity_ = new_byte_length;
760 byte_length_ = new_byte_length;
761 max_byte_length_ = new_byte_length;
762 return true;
763}
764
765v8::ArrayBuffer::Allocator* BackingStore::get_v8_api_array_buffer_allocator() {
766 CHECK(!is_wasm_memory_);
767 auto array_buffer_allocator =
768 holds_shared_ptr_to_allocator_
769 ? type_specific_data_.v8_api_array_buffer_allocator_shared.get()
770 : type_specific_data_.v8_api_array_buffer_allocator;
771 CHECK_NOT_NULL(array_buffer_allocator);
772 return array_buffer_allocator;
773}
774
775SharedWasmMemoryData* BackingStore::get_shared_wasm_memory_data() const {
776 CHECK(is_wasm_memory_ && is_shared_);
777 auto shared_wasm_memory_data = type_specific_data_.shared_wasm_memory_data;
778 CHECK(shared_wasm_memory_data);
779 return shared_wasm_memory_data;
780}
781
782namespace {
783// Implementation details of GlobalBackingStoreRegistry.
784struct GlobalBackingStoreRegistryImpl {
785 GlobalBackingStoreRegistryImpl() = default;
786 base::Mutex mutex_;
787 std::unordered_map<const void*, std::weak_ptr<BackingStore>> map_;
788};
789
790DEFINE_LAZY_LEAKY_OBJECT_GETTER(GlobalBackingStoreRegistryImpl,
791 GetGlobalBackingStoreRegistryImpl)
792} // namespace
793
794void GlobalBackingStoreRegistry::Register(
795 std::shared_ptr<BackingStore> backing_store) {
796 if (!backing_store || !backing_store->buffer_start()) return;
797 // Only wasm memory backing stores need to be registered globally.
798 CHECK(backing_store->is_wasm_memory());
799
800 GlobalBackingStoreRegistryImpl* impl = GetGlobalBackingStoreRegistryImpl();
801 base::MutexGuard scope_lock(&impl->mutex_);
802 if (backing_store->globally_registered_) return;
803 TRACE_BS("BS:reg bs=%p mem=%p (length=%zu, capacity=%zu)\n",
804 backing_store.get(), backing_store->buffer_start(),
805 backing_store->byte_length(), backing_store->byte_capacity());
806 std::weak_ptr<BackingStore> weak = backing_store;
807 auto result = impl->map_.insert({backing_store->buffer_start(), weak});
808 CHECK(result.second);
809 backing_store->globally_registered_ = true;
810}
811
812void GlobalBackingStoreRegistry::Unregister(BackingStore* backing_store) {
813 if (!backing_store->globally_registered_) return;
814
815 CHECK(backing_store->is_wasm_memory());
816
817 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(backing_store->buffer_start());
818
819 GlobalBackingStoreRegistryImpl* impl = GetGlobalBackingStoreRegistryImpl();
820 base::MutexGuard scope_lock(&impl->mutex_);
821 const auto& result = impl->map_.find(backing_store->buffer_start());
822 if (result != impl->map_.end()) {
823 DCHECK(!result->second.lock());
824 impl->map_.erase(result);
825 }
826 backing_store->globally_registered_ = false;
827}
828
829void GlobalBackingStoreRegistry::Purge(Isolate* isolate) {
830 // We need to keep a reference to all backing stores that are inspected
831 // in the purging loop below. Otherwise, we might get a deadlock
832 // if the temporary backing store reference created in the loop is
833 // the last reference. In that case the destructor of the backing store
834 // may try to take the &impl->mutex_ in order to unregister itself.
835 std::vector<std::shared_ptr<BackingStore>> prevent_destruction_under_lock;
836 GlobalBackingStoreRegistryImpl* impl = GetGlobalBackingStoreRegistryImpl();
837 base::MutexGuard scope_lock(&impl->mutex_);
838 // Purge all entries in the map that refer to the given isolate.
839 for (auto& entry : impl->map_) {
840 auto backing_store = entry.second.lock();
841 prevent_destruction_under_lock.emplace_back(backing_store);
842 if (!backing_store) continue; // skip entries where weak ptr is null
843 CHECK(backing_store->is_wasm_memory());
844 if (!backing_store->is_shared()) continue; // skip non-shared memory
845 SharedWasmMemoryData* shared_data =
846 backing_store->get_shared_wasm_memory_data();
847 // Remove this isolate from the isolates list.
848 std::vector<Isolate*>& isolates = shared_data->isolates_;
849 auto isolates_it = std::find(isolates.begin(), isolates.end(), isolate);
850 if (isolates_it != isolates.end()) {
851 *isolates_it = isolates.back();
852 isolates.pop_back();
853 }
854 DCHECK_EQ(isolates.end(),
855 std::find(isolates.begin(), isolates.end(), isolate));
856 }
857}
858
859#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
860void GlobalBackingStoreRegistry::AddSharedWasmMemoryObject(
861 Isolate* isolate, BackingStore* backing_store,
862 Handle<WasmMemoryObject> memory_object) {
863 // Add to the weak array list of shared memory objects in the isolate.
864 isolate->AddSharedWasmMemory(memory_object);
865
866 // Add the isolate to the list of isolates sharing this backing store.
867 GlobalBackingStoreRegistryImpl* impl = GetGlobalBackingStoreRegistryImpl();
868 base::MutexGuard scope_lock(&impl->mutex_);
869 SharedWasmMemoryData* shared_data =
870 backing_store->get_shared_wasm_memory_data();
871 auto& isolates = shared_data->isolates_;
872 int free_entry = -1;
873 for (size_t i = 0; i < isolates.size(); i++) {
874 if (isolates[i] == isolate) return;
875 if (isolates[i] == nullptr) free_entry = static_cast<int>(i);
876 }
877 if (free_entry >= 0)
878 isolates[free_entry] = isolate;
879 else
880 isolates.push_back(isolate);
881}
882
883void GlobalBackingStoreRegistry::BroadcastSharedWasmMemoryGrow(
884 Isolate* isolate, const BackingStore* backing_store) {
885 {
886 GlobalBackingStoreRegistryImpl* impl = GetGlobalBackingStoreRegistryImpl();
887 // The global lock protects the list of isolates per backing store.
888 base::MutexGuard scope_lock(&impl->mutex_);
889 SharedWasmMemoryData* shared_data =
890 backing_store->get_shared_wasm_memory_data();
891 for (Isolate* other : shared_data->isolates_) {
892 if (other == isolate) continue;
893 other->stack_guard()->RequestGrowSharedMemory();
894 }
895 }
896 // Update memory objects in this isolate.
897 UpdateSharedWasmMemoryObjects(isolate);
898}
899
900void GlobalBackingStoreRegistry::UpdateSharedWasmMemoryObjects(
901 Isolate* isolate) {
902 // TODO(1445003): Remove the {AlwaysAllocateScope} after finding the root
903 // cause.
904 AlwaysAllocateScope always_allocate_scope{isolate->heap()};
905
906 HandleScope scope(isolate);
907 Handle<WeakArrayList> shared_wasm_memories =
908 isolate->factory()->shared_wasm_memories();
909
910 for (int i = 0, e = shared_wasm_memories->length(); i < e; ++i) {
911 Tagged<HeapObject> obj;
912 if (!shared_wasm_memories->Get(i).GetHeapObject(&obj)) continue;
913
914 Handle<WasmMemoryObject> memory_object(WasmMemoryObject::cast(obj),
915 isolate);
916 Handle<JSArrayBuffer> old_buffer(memory_object->array_buffer(), isolate);
917 std::shared_ptr<BackingStore> backing_store = old_buffer->GetBackingStore();
918 // Wasm memory always has a BackingStore.
919 CHECK_NOT_NULL(backing_store);
920 CHECK(backing_store->is_wasm_memory());
921 CHECK(backing_store->is_shared());
922
923 // Keep a raw pointer to the backing store for a CHECK later one. Make it
924 // {void*} so we do not accidentally try to use it for anything else.
925 void* expected_backing_store = backing_store.get();
926
927 Handle<JSArrayBuffer> new_buffer =
928 isolate->factory()->NewJSSharedArrayBuffer(std::move(backing_store));
929 CHECK_EQ(expected_backing_store, new_buffer->GetBackingStore().get());
930 memory_object->SetNewBuffer(*new_buffer);
931 }
932}
933#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
934
935} // namespace internal
936} // namespace v8
